entry.title: Russia floats indefinitely postponing Karabakh status issue

media:group.media:title: Russia floats indefinitely postponing Karabakh status issue
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia proposed extending the mandate of the Russian peacekeeping contingent in Karabakh during talks in Sochi with Azerbaijan, said Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. üìçThe third meeting of the joint Armenia-Azerbaijan border commission will meet tomorrow in Brussels. üìçDirect flights between Yerevan and Tel Aviv will begin this month.

entry.title: ‚ÄúPeace is a necessity for Armenia, not for its neighbors‚Äù ‚Äì A talk with Garo Paylan

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúPeace is a necessity for Armenia, not for its neighbors‚Äù ‚Äì A talk with Garo Paylan
media:group.media:description:
Garo Paylan, a Turkish Armenian member of the Turkish parliament, sat down with CivilNet to talk about Turkey‚Äôs general elections next year and what they could mean for Armenia and Armenians. Paylan also discussed the strain Turkey‚Äôs civil society is under and the prospects for peace and reconciliation in the region.

entry.title: What came out of the Putin-Pashinyan-Aliyev meeting in Sochi?

media:group.media:title: What came out of the Putin-Pashinyan-Aliyev meeting in Sochi?
media:group.media:description:
The leaders of Armenia, Azerbaijan and Russia issued their fourth joint statement since the end of the 2020 Karabakh war. Lengthy talks on Monday in the Russian city of Sochi, saw Nikol Pashinyan, Ilham Aliyev and Vladimir Putin reaffirm their commitment to previously reached agreements and stress the need for a final peace agreement.

entry.title: Armenian legal teams making progress in international courts

media:group.media:title: Armenian legal teams making progress in international courts
media:group.media:description:
Yeghishe Kirakosyan, Armenia‚Äôs designated representative at the International Court of Justice in The Hague, sat down with CivilNet to discuss Armenian legal teams‚Äô progress at both the ICJ and the European Court of Human Rights. Kirakosyan also talks about Azerbaijan‚Äôs legal tactics in international cases and how Armenia approaches the International Criminal Court.

entry.title: ‚ÄúWe must do everything possible to raise awareness about the importance of the sciences‚Äù

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúWe must do everything possible to raise awareness about the importance of the sciences‚Äù
media:group.media:description:
Gayane Melikyan sat down with Lara Tcholakian to discuss the challenges related to transferring scientific knowledge to new generations and the lack of good role models who inspire new students in STEM. Gayane‚Äôs ancestors can be traced back to Kars, Calcutta, Talish, Shamshadin, Erzurum, and Javakhk, and she reflects on the role her family history had in her upbringing, and in transmitting the sense of self-respect, courage, and drive. Finally, education has been of central importance to Gayane and her family which has consequently strengthened her commitment to a number of projects and programs, including the 4090 Foundation.
About Gayane Melikyan Gayane Melikyan, MD, Ph.D. is a Consultant Neurologist at Hamad Medical Corporation, Qatar, and Assistant Professor of Neurology at Weill Cornell Medical College - Qatar. She is a member of the Armenian Neurology Board and a fellow at the Neurology Internship in Salzburg, Austria. Dr. Melikyan is a Former President of the Armenian League Against Epilepsy.. She is a member of international societies including the American Academy of Neurology and the American Epilepsy Society (AES), and has numerous publications in academic journals.
Program overview In a new open setting, Lara deconstructs inherited cultural and historical narratives, memories, life lessons and experiences from change catalysts. Her guests reflect on the stories, people, events and mindsets that have shaped their professional and personal lives, enabling them to create a more mindful life.
